natural problem: Define a function $h(x),$ for positive integer values of $x,$ by \[h(x) = \left\{\begin{aligned} \log_2 x & \quad \text{ if } \log_2 x \text{ is an integer} \\ 1 + h(x + 1) & \quad \text{ otherwise}. \end{aligned} \right.\]Compute $h(100).$
natural solution: Using the second part of the definition, we get \[h(100) = 1 + h(101) = 2 + h(102) = 3 + h(103) = \dots = 28 + h(128).\]Since $128 = 2^7,$ we use the first part of the definition to get \[h(100) = 28 + 7 = \boxed{35}.\]

a_0.formal problem:

where
"h x = (if (log 2 x \<in> \<nat>) then nat (log 2 x) else 1 + h (x + 1))"

termination
  by (relation "measure (\<lambda> x. nat (1 + log 2 x))") auto

 ### Proof
 Using the second part of the definition, we get \[h(100) = 1 + h(101) = 2 + h(102) = 3 + h(103) = \dots = 28 + h(128).\]Since $128 = 2^7,$ we use the first part of the definition to get \[h(100) = 28 + 7 = \boxed{35}.\]
 *)

a_3.formal problem:
function h :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
where 
  "h x = (if (\<exists>k. 2 ^ k = x) then (THE k. 2 ^ k = x) else 1 + h (x + 1))"
by pat_completeness auto
termination by (relation "measure (\<lambda>x. 1 + nat (2 ^ nat (ceiling (log 2 x)) - x))") auto
